The error 0x20E4 (ERROR_DS_CANT_FIND_EXPECTED_NC) indicates that the naming context could not be found.
The error 0x20E5 (ERROR_DS_CANT_FIND_NC_IN_CACHE) means the naming context could not be found in the cache.
The error 0x20E6 (ERROR_DS_CANT_RETRIEVE_CHILD) indicates that the child object could not be retrieved.
The error 0x20E7 (ERROR_DS_SECURITY_ILLEGAL_MODIFY) means that the modification was not permitted for security reasons.

The error 0x213B (ERROR_DS_ILLEGAL_BASE_SCHEMA_MOD) means an attempt was made to modify the base schema which is not allowed.
The error 0x213C (ERROR_DS_NONSAFE_SCHEMA_CHANGE) indicates that adding or removing certain attributes or modifying classes in the schema is not allowed due to safety concerns.
The error 0x213D (ERROR_DS_SCHEMA_UPDATE_DISALLOWED) means schema updates are not allowed on this domain controller because it is not the schema FSMO Role Owner.
The error 0x213E (ERROR_DS_CANT_CREATE_UNDER_SCHEMA) means an object of the specified class cannot be created under the schema container.

The error 0x213F (ERROR_DS_INSTALL_NO_SRC_SCH_VERSION) indicates that the replica installation failed to retrieve the objectVersion attribute from the schema container on the source domain controller.
The error 0x2140 (ERROR_DS_INSTALL_NO_SCH_VERSION_IN_INIFILE) means the replica installation failed to read the objectVersion attribute from the schema.ini file.
The error 0x2141 (ERROR_DS_INVALID_GROUP_TYPE) indicates that the specified group type is invalid.
The error 0x2142 (ERROR_DS_NO_NEST_GLOBALGROUP_IN_MIXEDDOMAIN) means you cannot nest global groups in a mixed domain if the group is security-enabled.
The error 0x2143 (ERROR_DS_NO_NEST_LOCALGROUP_IN_MIXEDDOMAIN) means you cannot nest local groups in a mixed domain if the group is security-enabled.
The error 0x2144 (ERROR_DS_GLOBAL_CANT_HAVE_LOCAL_MEMBER) means a global group cannot have a local group as a member.
The error 0x2145 (ERROR_DS_GLOBAL_CANT_HAVE_UNIVERSAL_MEMBER) means a global group cannot have a universal group as a member.
The error 0x2146 (ERROR_DS_UNIVERSAL_CANT_HAVE_LOCAL_MEMBER) means a universal group cannot have a local group as a member.
The error 0x2147 (ERROR_DS_GLOBAL_CANT_HAVE_CROSSDOMAIN_MEMBER) means a global group cannot have a cross-domain member.
The error 0x2148 (ERROR_DS_LOCAL_CANT_HAVE_CROSSDOMAIN_LOCAL_MEMBER) means a local group cannot have another cross-domain local group as a member.
The error 0x2149 (ERROR_DS_HAVE_PRIMARY_MEMBERS) indicates that a group with primary members cannot be changed to a security-disabled group.
The error 0x214A (ERROR_DS_STRING_SD_CONVERSION_FAILED) means the schema cache load failed to convert the string default security descriptor on a class-schema object.
The error 0x214B (ERROR_DS_NAMING_MASTER_GC) means only Domain Controllers configured as Global Catalog servers should be allowed to hold the Domain Naming Master FSMO role.
The error 0x214C (ERROR_DS_DNS_LOOKUP_FAILURE) indicates that a DNS lookup failure prevented the DSA operation from proceeding.
The error 0x214D (ERROR_DS_COULDNT_UPDATE_SPNS) means Service Principal Name values could not be kept in sync while processing a change to the DNS Host Name for an object.
The error 0x214E (ERROR_DS_CANT_RETRIEVE_SD) indicates that the Security Descriptor attribute could not be read.
The error 0x214F (ERROR_DS_KEY_NOT_UNIQUE) means the object was not found but an object with the same key was found.
The error 0x2150 (ERROR_DS_WRONG_LINKED_ATT_SYNTAX) means the syntax of the linked attribute being added is incorrect.
The error 0x2151 (ERROR_DS_SAM_NEED_BOOTKEY_PASSWORD) means the Security Account Manager needs to get the boot password.
The error 0x2152 (ERROR_DS_SAM_NEED_BOOTKEY_FLOPPY) means the Security Account Manager needs to get the boot key from a floppy disk.
The error 0x2153 (ERROR_DS_CANT_START) indicates that the Directory Service cannot start.
The error 0x2154 (ERROR_DS_INIT_FAILURE) means Directory Services could not start.
The error 0x2155 (ERROR_DS_NO_PKT_PRIVACY_ON_CONNECTION) means the connection requires packet privacy or better.
The error 0x2156 (ERROR_DS_SOURCE_DOMAIN_IN_FOREST) indicates that the source domain may not be in the same forest as the destination.
The error 0x2157 (ERROR_DS_DESTINATION_DOMAIN_NOT_IN_FOREST) means the destination domain must be in the same forest as the source.
The error 0x2158 (ERROR_DS_DESTINATION_AUDITING_NOT_ENABLED) means the operation requires destination domain auditing to be enabled.
The error 0x2159 (ERROR_DS_CANT_FIND_DC_FOR_SRC_DOMAIN) means the operation couldn't locate a Domain Controller for the source domain.
The error 0x215A (ERROR_DS_SRC_OBJ_NOT_GROUP_OR_USER) indicates that the source object must be a group or user.
The error 0x215B (ERROR_DS_SRC_SID_EXISTS_IN_FOREST) means the source object's SID already exists in the destination forest preventing the operation.
The error 0x215C (ERROR_DS_SRC_AND_DST_OBJECT_CLASS_MISMATCH) indicates that the source and destination objects must be of the same type for the operation to succeed.
The error 0x215D (ERROR_SAM_INIT_FAILURE) means Security Accounts Manager initialization failed and the system needs to reboot into Safe Mode for further diagnosis.
The error 0x215E (ERROR_DS_DRA_SCHEMA_INFO_SHIP) indicates that schema information could not be included in the replication request.
The error 0x215F (ERROR_DS_DRA_SCHEMA_CONFLICT) means the replication operation could not be completed due to a schema incompatibility between the source and destination.
The error 0x2160 (ERROR_DS_DRA_EARLIER_SCHEMA_CONFLICT) indicates the replication operation failed due to a previous schema conflict.
The error 0x2161 (ERROR_DS_DRA_OBJ_NC_MISMATCH) means the replication update couldn't be applied because of a mismatch in the object or naming context information.
The error 0x2162 (ERROR_DS_NC_STILL_HAS_DSAS) indicates that the domain cannot be deleted because there are domain controllers still hosting this domain.
The error 0x2163 (ERROR_DS_GC_REQUIRED) means that the requested operation can only be performed on a global catalog server.
The error 0x2164 (ERROR_DS_LOCAL_MEMBER_OF_LOCAL_ONLY) means a local group can only be a member of other local groups within the same domain.
The error 0x2165 (ERROR_DS_NO_FPO_IN_UNIVERSAL_GROUPS) means foreign security principals cannot be members of universal groups.
The error 0x2166 (ERROR_DS_CANT_ADD_TO_GC) indicates that an attribute is not allowed to be replicated to the global catalog (GC) for security reasons.
The error 0x2167 (ERROR_DS_NO_CHECKPOINT_WITH_PDC) means a checkpoint with the Primary Domain Controller (PDC) could not be taken due to a high volume of modifications being processed.
The error 0x2168 (ERROR_DS_SOURCE_AUDITING_NOT_ENABLED) means that the operation requires auditing to be enabled on the source domain.
The error 0x2169 (ERROR_DS_CANT_CREATE_IN_NONDOMAIN_NC) indicates that security principal objects can only be created inside domain naming contexts.
The error 0x216A (ERROR_DS_INVALID_NAME_FOR_SPN) means that a Service Principal Name (SPN) could not be constructed because the provided hostname is not in the necessary format.
The error 0x216B (ERROR_DS_FILTER_USES_CONTRUCTED_ATTRS) means the filter provided uses constructed attributes which are not supported.
The error 0x216C (ERROR_DS_UNICODEPWD_NOT_IN_QUOTES) means that the `unicodePwd` attribute value must be enclosed in double quotes.
The error 0x216D (ERROR_DS_MACHINE_ACCOUNT_QUOTA_EXCEEDED) means that the maximum number of computer accounts allowed in the domain has been exceeded.
The error 0x216E (ERROR_DS_MUST_BE_RUN_ON_DST_DC) means the operation must be run on the destination domain controller for security reasons.
The error 0x216F (ERROR_DS_SRC_DC_MUST_BE_SP4_OR_GREATER) means that the source domain controller must be running NT4 SP4 or a later version.
The error 0x2170 (ERROR_DS_CANT_TREE_DELETE_CRITICAL_OBJ) indicates that critical Directory Service system objects cannot be deleted during a tree delete operation.
The error 0x2171 (ERROR_DS_INIT_FAILURE_CONSOLE) means Directory Services could not start and the system should be shut down for further diagnosis using the recovery console.
The error 0x2172 (ERROR_DS_SAM_INIT_FAILURE_CONSOLE) indicates Security Accounts Manager initialization failed and the recovery console should be used for diagnosis.
The error 0x2173 (ERROR_DS_FOREST_VERSION_TOO_HIGH) means the version of the operating system is incompatible with the current AD DS forest functional level.
The error 0x2174 (ERROR_DS_DOMAIN_VERSION_TOO_HIGH) indicates the version of the operating system is incompatible with the current domain functional level.
The error 0x2175 (ERROR_DS_FOREST_VERSION_TOO_LOW) means the installed operating system version no longer supports the current AD DS forest functional level.
The error 0x2176 (ERROR_DS_DOMAIN_VERSION_TOO_LOW) means the installed operating system version no longer supports the current domain functional level.
The error 0x2177 (ERROR_DS_INCOMPATIBLE_VERSION) indicates that the installed operating system version is incompatible with the functional level of the domain or forest.
The error 0x2178 (ERROR_DS_LOW_DSA_VERSION) means the functional level of the domain cannot be raised because one or more domain controllers are at a lower incompatible functional level.
The error 0x2179 (ERROR_DS_NO_BEHAVIOR_VERSION_IN_MIXEDDOMAIN) means the forest functional level cannot be raised because one or more domains are still in mixed domain mode.
The error 0x217A (ERROR_DS_NOT_SUPPORTED_SORT_ORDER) means the requested sort order is not supported.
The error 0x217B (ERROR_DS_NAME_NOT_UNIQUE) means the requested name already exists as a unique identifier in the directory service.
The error 0x217C (ERROR_DS_MACHINE_ACCOUNT_CREATED_PRENT4) indicates the machine account was created prior to NT4 and needs to be recreated.
The error 0x217D (ERROR_DS_OUT_OF_VERSION_STORE) means the directory service database is out of version store.
The error 0x217E (ERROR_DS_INCOMPATIBLE_CONTROLS_USED) means multiple conflicting controls were used preventing the operation from continuing.
The error 0x217F (ERROR_DS_NO_REF_DOMAIN) means the directory service cannot find a valid security descriptor reference domain for the partition.
The error 0x2180 (ERROR_DS_RESERVED_LINK_ID) indicates that a schema update failed due to a reserved link identifier.
The error 0x2181 (ERROR_DS_LINK_ID_NOT_AVAILABLE) means that schema update failed because there are no available link identifiers.
The error 0x2182 (ERROR_DS_AG_CANT_HAVE_UNIVERSAL_MEMBER) means an account group cannot have a universal group as a member.
The error 0x2183 (ERROR_DS_MODIFYDN_DISALLOWED_BY_INSTANCE_TYPE) indicates that rename or move operations are not allowed on naming context heads or read-only objects.
The error 0x2184 (ERROR_DS_NO_OBJECT_MOVE_IN_SCHEMA_NC) means move operations are not allowed on objects in the schema naming context.
The error 0x2185 (ERROR_DS_MODIFYDN_DISALLOWED_BY_FLAG) indicates that a system flag is set on the object that prevents it from being moved or renamed.
The error 0x2186 (ERROR_DS_MODIFYDN_WRONG_GRANDPARENT) means that the object cannot change its grandparent container although moves are allowed within sibling containers.
The error 0x2187 (ERROR_DS_NAME_ERROR_TRUST_REFERRAL) indicates that the system was unable to resolve the operation and generated a referral to another forest.
The error 0x2188 (ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED_ON_STANDARD_SERVER) means the requested action is not supported on a standard server.
The error 0x2189 (ERROR_DS_CANT_ACCESS_REMOTE_PART_OF_AD) means the directory service could not access a partition located on a remote server.
The error 0x218A (ERROR_DS_CR_IMPOSSIBLE_TO_VALIDATE_V2) indicates the directory service cannot validate the proposed naming context because it cannot contact a replica of the parent naming context.
The error 0x218B (ERROR_DS_THREAD_LIMIT_EXCEEDED) means the thread limit for the request has been exceeded.
The error 0x218C (ERROR_DS_NOT_CLOSEST) indicates the Global Catalog server is not located in the closest site.
The error 0x218D (ERROR_DS_CANT_DERIVE_SPN_WITHOUT_SERVER_REF) means the directory service cannot derive a Service Principal Name (SPN) due to a missing server reference in the local DS database.
The error 0x218E (ERROR_DS_SINGLE_USER_MODE_FAILED) indicates the Directory Service failed to enter single-user mode.
The error 0x218F (ERROR_DS_NTDSCRIPT_SYNTAX_ERROR) means the Directory Service cannot parse the script due to a syntax error.
The error 0x2190 (ERROR_DS_NTDSCRIPT_PROCESS_ERROR) indicates the Directory Service encountered an error while processing the script.
The error 0x2191 (ERROR_DS_DIFFERENT_REPL_EPOCHS) means the directory service cannot perform the operation because the involved servers have different replication epochs.
The error 0x2192 (ERROR_DS_DRS_EXTENSIONS_CHANGED) means the directory service binding needs to be renegotiated due to changes in server extension information.
The error 0x2193 (ERROR_DS_REPLICA_SET_CHANGE_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_DISABLED_CR) indicates the operation is not allowed on a disabled cross-reference.
The error 0x2194 (ERROR_DS_NO_MSDS_INTID) means a schema update failed because no values for msDS-IntId are available.
The error 0x2195 (ERROR_DS_DUP_MSDS_INTID) indicates a schema update failed due to a duplicate msDS-IntId.
The error 0x2196 (ERROR_DS_EXISTS_IN_RDNATTID) means schema deletion failed because the attribute is used in rDNAttID.
The error 0x2197 (ERROR_DS_AUTHORIZATION_FAILED) indicates that the directory service failed to authorize the request.
The error 0x2198 (ERROR_DS_INVALID_SCRIPT) means the Directory Service cannot process the script because it is invalid.
The error 0x2199 (ERROR_DS_REMOTE_CROSSREF_OP_FAILED) means the remote create cross-reference operation failed on the Domain Naming Master FSMO and the error is in the extended data.
The error 0x219A (ERROR_DS_CROSS_REF_BUSY) means a cross-reference is in use locally with the same name.
The error 0x219B (ERROR_DS_CANT_DERIVE_SPN_FOR_DELETED_DOMAIN) means the DS cannot derive a service principal name (SPN) because the server's domain has been deleted from the forest.
The error 0x219C (ERROR_DS_CANT_DEMOTE_WITH_WRITEABLE_NC) indicates that writeable NCs are preventing the domain controller from being demoted.
The error 0x219D (ERROR_DS_DUPLICATE_ID_FOUND) means the requested object has a non-unique identifier and cannot be retrieved.
The error 0x219E (ERROR_DS_INSUFFICIENT_ATTR_TO_CREATE_OBJECT) means there are insufficient attributes to create the object. The object may have been deleted and garbage collected.
The error 0x219F (ERROR_DS_GROUP_CONVERSION_ERROR) means the group cannot be converted due to attribute restrictions on the requested group type.
The error 0x21A0 (ERROR_DS_CANT_MOVE_APP_BASIC_GROUP) means cross-domain moves of non-empty basic application groups are not allowed.
The error 0x21A1 (ERROR_DS_CANT_MOVE_APP_QUERY_GROUP) means cross-domain moves of non-empty query-based application groups are not allowed.
The error 0x21A2 (ERROR_DS_ROLE_NOT_VERIFIED) means FSMO role ownership could not be verified because its directory partition hasn't replicated successfully with at least one partner.
The error 0x21A3 (ERROR_DS_WKO_CONTAINER_CANNOT_BE_SPECIAL) means the target container for a redirection of a well-known object container cannot already be a special container.
The error 0x21A4 (ERROR_DS_DOMAIN_RENAME_IN_PROGRESS) means the directory service cannot perform the requested operation because a domain rename operation is in progress.

The error 0x21A5 (ERROR_DS_EXISTING_AD_CHILD_NC) indicates the directory service detected a child partition below the requested partition name requiring the partition hierarchy to be created top-down.
The error 0x21A6 (ERROR_DS_REPL_LIFETIME_EXCEEDED) means the directory service cannot replicate because the time since the last replication with this server has exceeded the tombstone lifetime.
The error 0x21A7 (ERROR_DS_DISALLOWED_IN_SYSTEM_CONTAINER) means the requested operation is not allowed on an object under the system container.

The error 0x21A8 (ERROR_DS_LDAP_SEND_QUEUE_FULL) indicates that the LDAP server's network send queue is full because the client is not processing requests fast enough. No more requests will be processed until the client catches up.
The error 0x21A9 (ERROR_DS_DRA_OUT_SCHEDULE_WINDOW) means the scheduled replication did not take place because the system was too busy to execute the request within the schedule window.
The error 0x21AA (ERROR_DS_POLICY_NOT_KNOWN) means the branch replication policy is not known at the moment possibly due to replication latencies.
The error 0x21AB (ERROR_NO_SITE_SETTINGS_OBJECT) means the site settings object for the specified site does not exist.
The error 0x21AC (ERROR_NO_SECRETS) means the local account store does not contain secret material for the specified account.
The error 0x21AD (ERROR_NO_WRITABLE_DC_FOUND) means no writable domain controller was found in the domain.
The error 0x21AE (ERROR_DS_NO_SERVER_OBJECT) means the server object for the domain controller does not exist.
The error 0x21AF (ERROR_DS_NO_NTDSA_OBJECT) means the NTDS Settings object for the domain controller does not exist.
The error 0x21B0 (ERROR_DS_NON_ASQ_SEARCH) means the requested search operation is not supported for ASQ searches.
The error 0x21B1 (ERROR_DS_AUDIT_FAILURE) means a required audit event could not be generated for the operation.
The error 0x21B2 (ERROR_DS_INVALID_SEARCH_FLAG_SUBTREE) indicates invalid search flags for the attribute. The subtree index bit is valid only on single-valued attributes.
The error 0x21B3 (ERROR_DS_INVALID_SEARCH_FLAG_TUPLE) means invalid search flags for the attribute. The tuple index bit is valid only on Unicode string attributes.
The error 0x21B4 (ERROR_DS_HIERARCHY_TABLE_TOO_DEEP) means the address books are nested too deeply to build the hierarchy table.
The error 0x21B5 (ERROR_DS_DRA_CORRUPT_UTD_VECTOR) means the specified up-to-date-ness vector is corrupt.
The error 0x21B6 (ERROR_DS_DRA_SECRETS_DENIED) indicates that the request to replicate secrets was denied.
The error 0x21B7 (ERROR_DS_RESERVED_MAPI_ID) indicates schema update failed due to a reserved MAPI identifier.
The error 0x21B8 (ERROR_DS_MAPI_ID_NOT_AVAILABLE) means schema update failed due to no available MAPI identifiers.
The error 0x21B9 (ERROR_DS_DRA_MISSING_KRBTGT_SECRET) means the replication operation failed because the required attributes of the local krbtgt object are missing.
The error 0x21BA (ERROR_DS_DOMAIN_NAME_EXISTS_IN_FOREST) indicates the domain name of the trusted domain already exists in the forest.
The error 0x21BB (ERROR_DS_FLAT_NAME_EXISTS_IN_FOREST) indicates the flat name of the trusted domain already exists in the forest.
The error 0x21BC (ERROR_INVALID_USER_PRINCIPAL_NAME) means the User Principal Name (UPN) is invalid.
The error 0x21BD (ERROR_DS_OID_MAPPED_GROUP_CANT_HAVE_MEMBERS) indicates that OID mapped groups cannot have members.
The error 0x21BE (ERROR_DS_OID_NOT_FOUND) means the specified OID cannot be found.
The error 0x21BF (ERROR_DS_DRA_RECYCLED_TARGET) means the replication operation failed because the target object referred by a link value is recycled.
The error 0x21C0 (ERROR_DS_DISALLOWED_NC_REDIRECT) means the redirect operation failed because the target object is in a different NC than the current domain controller.
The error 0x21C1 (ERROR_DS_HIGH_ADLDS_FFL) indicates that the functional level of the AD LDS configuration set cannot be lowered to the requested value.
The error 0x21C2 (ERROR_DS_HIGH_DSA_VERSION) means the functional level of the domain (or forest) cannot be lowered to the requested value.
The error 0x21C3 (ERROR_DS_LOW_ADLDS_FFL) indicates that the AD LDS functional level cannot be raised to the requested value because of lower incompatible instances.
The error 0x21C4 (ERROR_DOMAIN_SID_SAME_AS_LOCAL_WORKSTATION) means the domain join cannot be completed because the SID of the domain is identical to the SID of the machine.
The error 0x21C5 (ERROR_DS_UNDELETE_SAM_VALIDATION_FAILED) means the undelete operation failed because the Sam Account Name or Additional Sam Account Name conflicts with an existing object.
The error 0x21C6 (ERROR_INCORRECT_ACCOUNT_TYPE) means the system is not authoritative for the specified account and cannot complete the operation. Retry with the correct provider.
The error 0x2329 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_FORMAT_ERROR) means the DNS server is unable to interpret the format of the request.
The error 0x232A (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_SERVER_FAILURE) indicates a DNS server failure.
The error 0x232B (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_NAME_ERROR) means the DNS name does not exist.
The error 0x232C (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_NOT_IMPLEMENTED) means the DNS request is not supported by the name server.
The error 0x232D (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_REFUSED) means the DNS operation was refused.
The error 0x232E (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_YXDOMAIN) indicates the DNS name that should not exist does exist.
The error 0x232F (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_YXRRSET) indicates a DNS RR set that should not exist does exist.
The error 0x2330 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_NXRRSET) means a DNS RR set that should exist does not exist.
The error 0x2331 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_NOTAUTH) means the DNS server is not authoritative for the zone.
The error 0x2332 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_NOTZONE) means the DNS name in an update or prerequisite is not in the zone.
The error 0x2338 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_BADSIG) means the DNS signature failed to verify.
The error 0x2339 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_BADKEY) means there is a bad key in the DNS operation.
The error 0x233A (DNS_ERROR_RCODE_BADTIME) means the DNS signature validity has expired.
The error 0x238D (DNS_ERROR_KEYMASTER_REQUIRED) means only the DNS server acting as the key master for the zone can perform this operation.
The error 0x238E (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_SIGNED_ZONE) means the operation is not allowed on a zone that is signed or has signing keys.
The error 0x238F (DNS_ERROR_NSEC3_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_RSA_SHA1) means NSEC3 is incompatible with the RSA-SHA-1 algorithm. A different algorithm or NSEC should be used.
The error 0x2390 (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_SIGNING_KEY_DESCRIPTORS) means the zone does not have enough signing keys. At least one key signing key (KSK) and one zone signing key (ZSK) are required.
The error 0x2391 (DNS_ERROR_UNSUPPORTED_ALGORITHM) means the specified algorithm is not supported.
The error 0x2392 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_KEY_SIZE) means the specified key size is not supported.
The error 0x2393 (DNS_ERROR_SIGNING_KEY_NOT_ACCESSIBLE) indicates one or more of the signing keys for the zone are not accessible to the DNS server.
The error 0x2394 (DNS_ERROR_KSP_DOES_NOT_SUPPORT_PROTECTION) means the specified key storage provider does not support DPAPI++ data protection.
The error 0x2395 (DNS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED_DATA_PROTECTION_ERROR) means an unexpected DPAPI++ error was encountered.
The error 0x2396 (DNS_ERROR_UNEXPECTED_CNG_ERROR) means an unexpected crypto error was encountered.

The error 0x2397 (DNS_ERROR_UNKNOWN_SIGNING_PARAMETER_VERSION) means the DNS server encountered a signing key with an unknown version and zone signing will not be operational until this error is resolved.
The error 0x2398 (DNS_ERROR_KSP_NOT_ACCESSIBLE) means the specified key service provider cannot be opened by the DNS server.
The error 0x2399 (DNS_ERROR_TOO_MANY_SKDS) means the DNS server cannot accept any more signing keys with the specified algorithm and KSK flag value for this zone.
The error 0x239A (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_ROLLOVER_PERIOD) means the specified rollover period is invalid.
The error 0x239B (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_INITIAL_ROLLOVER_OFFSET) means the specified initial rollover offset is invalid.
The error 0x239C (DNS_ERROR_ROLLOVER_IN_PROGRESS) means the specified signing key is already in the process of rolling over keys.
The error 0x239D (DNS_ERROR_STANDBY_KEY_NOT_PRESENT) means the specified signing key does not have a standby key to revoke.
The error 0x239E (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_ZSK) means this operation is not allowed on a zone signing key (ZSK).
The error 0x239F (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_ACTIVE_SKD) means this operation is not allowed on an active signing key.
The error 0x23A0 (DNS_ERROR_ROLLOVER_ALREADY_QUEUED) means the specified signing key is already queued for rollover.
The error 0x23A1 (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_UNSIGNED_ZONE) means this operation is not allowed on an unsigned zone.
The error 0x23A2 (DNS_ERROR_BAD_KEYMASTER) means this operation could not be completed because the DNS server listed as the current key master for this zone is down or misconfigured.
The error 0x23A3 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_SIGNATURE_VALIDITY_PERIOD) means the specified signature validity period is invalid.
The error 0x23A4 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_NSEC3_ITERATION_COUNT) means the specified NSEC3 iteration count is higher than allowed by the minimum key length used in the zone.
The error 0x23A5 (DNS_ERROR_DNSSEC_IS_DISABLED) means this operation could not be completed because DNSSEC features are disabled on the DNS server.
The error 0x23A6 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_XML) means the XML stream received is empty or syntactically invalid.
The error 0x23A7 (DNS_ERROR_NO_VALID_TRUST_ANCHORS) means no valid trust anchors were added because the received trust anchors are invalid unsupported expired or invalid in less than 30 days.
The error 0x23A8 (DNS_ERROR_ROLLOVER_NOT_POKEABLE) means the specified signing key is not waiting for a parental DS update.
The error 0x23A9 (DNS_ERROR_NSEC3_NAME_COLLISION) means a hash collision was detected during NSEC3 signing. A different or randomly generated salt should be used.
The error 0x23AA (DNS_ERROR_NSEC_INCOMPATIBLE_WITH_NSEC3_RSA_SHA1) means NSEC is incompatible with the NSEC3-RSA-SHA-1 algorithm. A different algorithm or NSEC3 should be used.
The error 0x251D (DNS_INFO_NO_RECORDS) means no records were found for the given DNS query.
The error 0x251E (DNS_ERROR_BAD_PACKET) means a bad DNS packet.
The error 0x251F (DNS_ERROR_NO_PACKET) means no DNS packet was received.
The error 0x2520 (DNS_ERROR_RCODE) means a DNS error occurred check the rcode for more details.
The error 0x2521 (DNS_ERROR_UNSECURE_PACKET) means the DNS packet is unsecured.
The error 0x2522 (DNS_REQUEST_PENDING) means the DNS query request is still pending.
The error 0x254F (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_TYPE) means the DNS type is invalid.
The error 0x2550 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_IP_ADDRESS) means the IP address provided is invalid.
The error 0x2551 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_PROPERTY) means the property specified is invalid.
The error 0x2552 (DNS_ERROR_TRY_AGAIN_LATER) means the DNS operation should be retried later.
The error 0x2553 (DNS_ERROR_NOT_UNIQUE) means the record for the given name and type is not unique.
The error 0x2554 (DNS_ERROR_NON_RFC_NAME) means the DNS name does not comply with RFC specifications.
The error 0x2555 (DNS_STATUS_FQDN) means the DNS name is a fully-qualified DNS name.
The error 0x2556 (DNS_STATUS_DOTTED_NAME) means the DNS name is a dotted (multi-label) name.
The error 0x2557 (DNS_STATUS_SINGLE_PART_NAME) means the DNS name is a single-part name.
The error 0x2558 (DNS_ERROR_INVALID_NAME_CHAR) means the DNS name contains an invalid character.
The error 0x2559 (DNS_ERROR_NUMERIC_NAME) means the DNS name is entirely numeric.
The error 0x255A (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_ON_ROOT_SERVER) means the operation requested is not permitted on a DNS root server.
The error 0x255B (DNS_ERROR_NOT_ALLOWED_UNDER_DELEGATION) means the record could not be created because this part of the DNS namespace has been delegated to another server.
The error 0x255C (DNS_ERROR_CANNOT_FIND_ROOT_HINTS) means the DNS server could not find a set of root hints.
The error 0x255D (DNS_ERROR_INCONSISTENT_ROOT_HINTS) means the DNS server found root hints but they were not consistent across all adapters.
The error 0x255E (DNS_ERROR_DWORD_VALUE_TOO_SMALL) means the specified value is too small for this parameter.

The error 0x3668 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_STATE_LOOKUP_FAILED) means IPsec DoS Protection failed to look up state.
The error 0x3669 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_MAX_ENTRIES) means IPsec DoS Protection reached the maximum allowed entries as per policy.
The error 0x366A (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_KEYMOD_NOT_ALLOWED) means IPsec DoS Protection received a negotiation packet for a keying module which is not allowed by policy.
The error 0x366B (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_NOT_INSTALLED) means IPsec DoS Protection has not been enabled.
The error 0x366C (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_MAX_PER_IP_RATELIMIT_QUEUES) indicates failure to create a per internal IP rate limit queue due to policy limits.
The error 0x36B0 (ERROR_SXS_SECTION_NOT_FOUND) means the requested section was not present in the activation context.
The error 0x36B1 (ERROR_SXS_CANT_GEN_ACTCTX) means the application failed to start due to incorrect side-by-side configuration.
The error 0x36B2 (ERROR_SXS_INVALID_ACTCTXDATA_FORMAT) means the application binding data format is invalid.
The error 0x3635 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_RPC_DELETE) means that the system was deleted via RPC call.
The error 0x364D (ERROR_IPSEC_KEY_MODULE_IMPERSONATION_NEGOTIATION_PENDING) indicates that a negotiation is in progress as the security principle who issued the connection.
The error 0x364E (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_COEXISTENCE_SUPPRESS) occurs when an SA is deleted due to IKEv1/AuthIP co-existence suppress check.
The error 0x364F (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_RATELIMIT_DROP) means that an incoming SA request was dropped due to peer IP address rate limiting.
The error 0x3650 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_PEER_DOESNT_SUPPORT_MOBIKE) indicates that the peer does not support MOBIKE.
The error 0x3651 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_AUTHORIZATION_FAILURE) means that the SA establishment is not authorized.
The error 0x3652 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_STRONG_CRED_AUTHORIZATION_FAILURE) indicates that the SA establishment failed due to insufficiently strong PKINIT-based credentials.
The error 0x3653 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_AUTHORIZATION_FAILURE_WITH_OPTIONAL_RETRY) means SA establishment is not authorized and a retry with updated credentials may be needed.
The error 0x3654 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_STRONG_CRED_AUTHORIZATION_AND_CERTMAP_FAILURE) indicates that SA establishment failed due to lack of strong credentials or certificate-to-account mapping failure.
The error 0x3655 (ERROR_IPSEC_IKE_NEG_STATUS_EXTENDED_END) means that the negotiation status ended unexpectedly.
The error 0x3656 (ERROR_IPSEC_BAD_SPI) occurs when the SPI in the packet does not match a valid IPsec SA.
The error 0x3657 (ERROR_IPSEC_SA_LIFETIME_EXPIRED) means the packet was received on an IPsec SA whose lifetime has expired.
The error 0x3658 (ERROR_IPSEC_WRONG_SA) means the packet was received on an IPsec SA that does not match the packet characteristics.
The error 0x3659 (ERROR_IPSEC_REPLAY_CHECK_FAILED) indicates that the packet sequence number replay check failed.
The error 0x365A (ERROR_IPSEC_INVALID_PACKET) means the IPsec header and/or trailer in the packet is invalid.
The error 0x365B (ERROR_IPSEC_INTEGRITY_CHECK_FAILED) means the IPsec integrity check failed.
The error 0x365C (ERROR_IPSEC_CLEAR_TEXT_DROP) indicates that IPsec dropped a clear text packet.
The error 0x365D (ERROR_IPSEC_AUTH_FIREWALL_DROP) means IPsec dropped an incoming ESP packet in authenticated firewall mode.
The error 0x365E (ERROR_IPSEC_THROTTLE_DROP) indicates that IPsec dropped a packet due to DoS throttling.
The error 0x3665 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_BLOCK) means that IPsec DoS Protection matched an explicit block rule.
The error 0x3666 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_RECEIVED_MULTICAST) indicates that IPsec DoS Protection received a multicast packet which is not allowed.
The error 0x3667 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_INVALID_PACKET) means that IPsec DoS Protection received an incorrectly formatted packet.
The error 0x3668 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_STATE_LOOKUP_FAILED) indicates that IPsec DoS Protection failed to look up state.
The error 0x3669 (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_MAX_ENTRIES) means that IPsec DoS Protection failed to create state because the maximum number of entries allowed by policy was reached.
The error 0x366A (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_KEYMOD_NOT_ALLOWED) means that IPsec DoS Protection received a negotiation packet for a keying module not allowed by policy.
The error 0x366B (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_NOT_INSTALLED) means that IPsec DoS Protection has not been enabled.

The error 0x366C (ERROR_IPSEC_DOSP_MAX_PER_IP_RATELIMIT_QUEUES) indicates that IPsec DoS Protection failed to create a per internal IP rate limit queue because the maximum number of queues allowed by policy has been reached.
The error 0x36B0 (ERROR_SXS_SECTION_NOT_FOUND) indicates that the requested section was not present in the activation context.

Query: How do I change the desktop background in Windows?
Response: Right-click on the desktop and select 'Personalize.' Then click 'Background' and choose an image or color. You can also browse for an image file by clicking 'Browse.'

Query: How can I adjust the screen brightness in Windows?
Response: In Windows 10 go to 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Display' and use the 'Change brightness' slider. If you have a laptop with function keys (like F1-F12) you can press the corresponding key to adjust brightness.

Query: What is the shortcut to open Task Manager?
Response: Press 'Ctrl + Shift + Esc' to open Task Manager or 'Ctrl + Alt + Delete' and then click 'Task Manager.'

Query: How do I create a new user account on Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Accounts' > 'Family & other users.' Under 'Other users' click 'Add someone else to this PC' and follow the instructions to create a new account.

Query: How can I change the date and time in Windows?
Response: Right-click on the time and date in the taskbar and select 'Adjust date/time.' Here you can set the time date and time zone. If you want to manually adjust it disable 'Set time automatically.'

Query: How do I install a new printer in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Devices' > 'Printers & scanners.' Click 'Add a printer or scanner' and follow the prompts to install your printer.

Query: What is the 'Blue Screen of Death' (BSOD) in Windows?
Response: The 'Blue Screen of Death (BSOD)' occurs when Windows encounters a critical error often related to hardware drivers or system files. It usually displays a stop error code and advises rebooting the system.

Query: How can I update Windows 10 to the latest version?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Windows Update' then click 'Check for updates.' Install any available updates.

Query: How do I enable or disable Windows Defender?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Privacy & Security' > 'Windows Security.' Click on 'Virus & Threat Protection' and toggle the settings to turn it on or off.

Query: How do I uninstall a program in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Apps & Features' select the program you want to uninstall and click 'Uninstall.'

Query: How do I enable night light mode in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Display.' Toggle on 'Night light' and you can adjust the color temperature to reduce blue light exposure.

Query: How can I use the Snipping Tool in Windows?
Response: Open the 'Snipping Tool' via the Start menu or type 'Snipping Tool' in the search bar. Click 'New' to capture a screenshot and choose from free-form rectangular window or full-screen snips.

Query: How do I disable automatic updates in Windows?
Response: In 'Settings' go to 'Update & Security' > 'Windows Update' click 'Advanced options' and under 'Choose when updates are installed' select the desired update settings.

Query: What is the Windows Event Viewer and how do I access it?
Response: The 'Event Viewer' allows you to view detailed logs of system events errors and warnings. To access it type 'Event Viewer' in the Start menu search bar and open it.

Query: How do I change the default browser in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Default apps' scroll down to 'Web browser' and choose your preferred browser.

Query: How can I run a program as an administrator in Windows?
Response: Right-click on the program's shortcut and select 'Run as administrator.' You may need to provide administrator credentials.

Query: What is the difference between Windows 10 Home and Pro editions?
Response: Windows 10 Pro includes additional features like BitLocker encryption Group Policy management and the ability to join a domain. Home edition is more suited for general consumer use.

Query: How can I check my Windows version and build?
Response: Press 'Windows key + R' type 'winver' and press Enter. A window will appear showing your Windows version edition and build number.

Query: How do I enable or disable the firewall in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Privacy & Security' > 'Windows Security' > 'Firewall & network protection.' Here you can turn on or off the firewall for different network profiles (Private Public Domain).

Query: How can I access the Control Panel in Windows 10?
Response: Type 'Control Panel' in the Start menu search bar and select it from the results.

Query: What is Safe Mode in Windows and how do I boot into it?
Response: Safe Mode starts Windows with minimal drivers and software. To boot into Safe Mode press 'Shift' while selecting 'Restart' from the Start menu then select 'Troubleshoot' > 'Advanced options' > 'Startup Settings' and press 'Restart.' Choose '4' or 'F4' for Safe Mode.

Query: How do I perform a system restore in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Control Panel' > 'System and Security' > 'System' then click 'System Protection.' Under the 'System Protection' tab click 'System Restore' and follow the prompts.

Query: What is the Windows Security Center?
Response: The 'Windows Security Center' manages your systemâ€™s security features like Windows Defender firewall and device performance. It can be accessed via 'Settings' > 'Privacy & Security' > 'Windows Security.'

Query: How do I take a screenshot on Windows?
Response: Press 'PrtScn' to take a screenshot of the entire screen. Press 'Windows key + Shift + S' to open the Snip & Sketch tool for more control over the screenshot area.

Query: How can I manage startup programs in Windows?
Response: Right-click on the taskbar and select 'Task Manager.' Go to the 'Startup' tab where you can disable or enable programs that launch on startup.

Query: How do I use Windows Update to fix issues?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Windows Update.' Click 'Check for updates' and let Windows apply any available fixes or patches.

Query: How can I fix a slow Windows 10 PC?
Response: Try clearing temporary files with 'Disk Cleanup' disabling unnecessary startup programs upgrading hardware like RAM and running a system scan with Windows Defender.

Query: How do I recover a deleted file in Windows?
Response: Open 'Recycle Bin' on the desktop locate the deleted file right-click it and select 'Restore' to recover it to its original location.

Query: How do I change the screen resolution in Windows?
Response: Right-click on the desktop and select 'Display settings.' Under 'Display resolution' select the desired resolution from the drop-down list.

Query: How do I use Windows Disk Cleanup?
Response: Type 'Disk Cleanup' in the Start menu search bar and select it. Select the drive you want to clean and check the file types to delete then click 'OK' and 'Delete Files.'

Query: How can I check for hardware issues in Windows?
Response: Open 'Device Manager' from the Start menu and look for any devices with a yellow triangle. You can also run the built-in 'Hardware Troubleshooter' from 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Troubleshoot.'

Query: How do I check system performance in Windows Task Manager?
Response: Press 'Ctrl + Shift + Esc' to open Task Manager. Go to the 'Performance' tab to view CPU memory disk and network usage in real time.

Query: How do I upgrade from Windows 7 to Windows 10?
Response: Go to the Windows 10 download page use the 'Upgrade Now' tool to download and install Windows 10 or use the Media Creation Tool to create a bootable USB for installation.

Query: What is Windows PowerShell and how do I use it?
Response: Windows PowerShell is a command-line interface for advanced system management. To open it type 'PowerShell' in the search bar and select it. Use PowerShell for tasks like file management and automation.

Query: How can I disable Windows tips and notifications?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Notifications & actions.' Here you can toggle off tips and notifications from Windows and apps.

Query: How do I manage user permissions in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Accounts' > 'Family & other users.' Select a user account and click 'Change account type' to modify their permissions between standard or administrator.

Query: How can I install a Windows update manually?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Windows Update' and click 'View update history.' From there you can download and install specific updates manually.

Query: How do I access the Device Manager in Windows?
Response: Type 'Device Manager' in the search bar and click it from the results. You can also access it from 'Control Panel' > 'System' > 'Device Manager.'

Query: How do I set up a VPN on Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Network & Internet' > 'VPN.' Click 'Add a VPN connection' enter the VPN provider information and connect.

Query: What is Windows 10â€™s Action Center used for?
Response: The Action Center is used for notifications and quick settings. It can be accessed by clicking the speech bubble icon in the taskbar or by pressing 'Windows + A.'

Query: How do I back up my files in Windows 10?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Backup' and use File History to back up files. You can also use 'OneDrive' for cloud backups.

Query: How do I install a font in Windows?
Response: Download the font file right-click it and select 'Install.' The font will then be available in applications like Word and Photoshop.

Query: How do I change the language settings in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Time & Language' > 'Language' and click 'Add a language.' Select your desired language and follow the prompts to set it as default.

Query: How is a system image backup created in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Control Panel' > 'System and Security' > 'Backup and Restore.' Click 'Create a system image' on the left and follow the instructions.

Query: How can I enable or disable Bluetooth in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Devices' > 'Bluetooth & other devices' and toggle the Bluetooth setting on or off.

Query: How do I delete temporary files in Windows?
Response: Open 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Storage' and click 'Temporary files' to select and delete unnecessary files.

Query: How do I check my PC's memory usage in Windows?
Response: Press 'Ctrl + Shift + Esc' to open Task Manager then go to the 'Performance' tab to see memory usage.

Query: How is Windows Defender Offline used?
Response: Windows Defender Offline runs a scan outside of Windows to detect hard-to-find malware. It can be run from the 'Windows Security' settings under 'Virus & Threat Protection.'

Query: How do I use Cortana on Windows?
Response: Click the Cortana icon or press 'Windows + C.' Ask your question or request an action and Cortana will respond.

Query: How do I clear my browsing history in Windows?
Response: Clear browsing history in your browser's settings (e.g. Edge Chrome Firefox). In Edge go to 'Settings' > 'Privacy search and services' > 'Choose what to clear.'

Query: How do I change the default file explorer in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Default apps.' Scroll down and select 'Choose default apps by file type.' Then assign a new file explorer.

Query: How is the Windows Action Center accessed?
Response: Click the speech bubble icon in the taskbar or press 'Windows + A' to open the Action Center.

Query: How can I stop a program from running at startup?
Response: Open 'Task Manager' (Ctrl + Shift + Esc) go to the 'Startup' tab right-click the program and select 'Disable.'

Query: How do I fix Windows Update errors?
Response: Try running the 'Windows Update Troubleshooter' from 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Troubleshoot.' You can also manually reset Windows Update components.

Query: How do I change my Windows password?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Accounts' > 'Sign-in options.' Under 'Password' click 'Change' and follow the prompts.

Query: How do I disable Windows startup sounds?
Response: Go to 'Control Panel' > 'Hardware and Sound' > 'Sound' then under 'Sounds' select 'No Sounds' from the drop-down menu.

Query: How do I recover my Windows account if I forgot my password?
Response: On the login screen click 'I forgot my password' and follow the prompts to reset it via your Microsoft account or local recovery options.

Query: How can I remove unwanted apps from Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Apps' > 'Apps & Features' select the app you want to uninstall and click 'Uninstall.'

Query: How do I set up parental controls in Windows 10?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Accounts' > 'Family & other users.' Click 'Add a family member' and set up restrictions through Microsoft Family Safety.

Query: How can I enable or disable Windows animations?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Ease of Access' > 'Display' and toggle 'Show animations in Windows.'

Query: How is Windows Compatibility Mode used?
Response: Right-click on the program's executable select 'Properties' go to the 'Compatibility' tab and check 'Run this program in compatibility mode.'

Query: How do I adjust the volume on Windows?
Response: Click the speaker icon in the taskbar and use the slider to adjust the volume.

Query: How can I use Windows Disk Management to manage partitions?
Response: Right-click the Start button and select 'Disk Management.' Here you can create delete or modify partitions.

Query: How do I change the theme in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Personalization' > 'Themes.' You can choose a predefined theme or create your own.

Query: How can I access the Windows 10 Settings menu?
Response: Click the Start button and select the gear icon or press 'Windows key + I.'

Query: How do I view installed updates in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Windows Update' and click 'View update history.'

Query: How do I enable or disable sleep mode in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Power & Sleep' and select the desired sleep settings.

Query: How can I set up a network connection in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Network & Internet' and select 'Wi-Fi' or 'Ethernet' to configure your network.

Query: How do I uninstall a driver in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Device Manager' right-click the device and select 'Uninstall device.'

Query: How can I customize the Start menu in Windows 10?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Personalization' > 'Start.' Here you can customize which items appear in the Start menu.

Query: How do I add a new printer to Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Devices' > 'Printers & Scanners' and click 'Add a printer or scanner.' Follow the prompts to add the printer.

Query: How are Windows troubleshooting tools used?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Update & Security' > 'Troubleshoot.' You can run troubleshooting wizards for various issues like network or audio problems.

Query: How do I enable or disable Windows Search indexing?
Response: Go to 'Control Panel' > 'Indexing Options' and click 'Modify' to add or remove locations from indexing.

Query: How can I restore a previous version of a file in Windows?
Response: Right-click the file select 'Properties' and go to the 'Previous Versions' tab to restore a previous version.

Query: How do I check for disk errors in Windows?
Response: Open 'This PC' right-click a drive select 'Properties' > 'Tools' and click 'Check' under 'Error checking.'

Query: How do I open the Command Prompt in Windows?
Response: Type 'Command Prompt' or 'cmd' in the Start menu search bar and select it.

Query: How can I delete a folder that is not deleting in Windows?
Response: Try using 'Safe Mode' or use a third-party tool like 'Unlocker' to delete the folder.

Query: How do I adjust the mouse settings in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Devices' > 'Mouse.' Here you can adjust settings like pointer speed and button assignments.

Query: How do I enable or disable Windows notifications?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'System' > 'Notifications & actions' to enable or disable notifications for apps.

Query: How do I install Windows updates offline?
Response: You can download updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog website and install them manually.

Query: How can I fix missing system files in Windows?
Response: Run the 'System File Checker' tool by typing 'sfc /scannow' in Command Prompt (admin).

Query: How is a 32-bit and 64-bit version of Windows different?
Response: 64-bit Windows can handle more RAM and run 64-bit applications whereas 32-bit Windows has limitations on memory and compatibility.

Query: How do I fix Windows startup issues?
Response: Boot into Safe Mode or use 'Startup Repair' from 'Advanced Startup Options' to fix startup issues.

Query: How do I set a custom desktop icon in Windows?
Response: Right-click the desktop select 'New' > 'Shortcut' and follow the prompts to create a shortcut with a custom icon.

Query: How do I change the user account type in Windows?
Response: Go to 'Settings' > 'Accounts' > 'Family & other users' select the user and click 'Change account type.'

Query: How do I turn off automatic restart in Windows after an error?

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a USB drive to run Windows on another computer?
Response: Use the Windows To Go feature or third-party tools to create a bootable Windows 10 USB drive. Follow the instructions to install and boot Windows from the USB drive.

Query: How do I fix a 'Windows 10 installation failed' error during the upgrade process?
Response: Try troubleshooting by checking system compatibility running the Windows Update Troubleshooter and ensuring thereâ€™s enough disk space. Retry the upgrade after addressing the issues.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a system with low memory?
Response: Ensure that the system meets the minimum RAM requirement (2 GB). If the installation process is slow or fails try upgrading the RAM or performing a minimal installation.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 when the installation file is corrupted?
Response: Re-download the Windows 10 installation file using the Windows Media Creation Tool or obtain a fresh copy from the official Microsoft website.

Query: How do I reinstall Windows 10 on a machine without recovery media?
Response: If the system is operational use the 'Reset this PC' option in the Settings menu to reinstall Windows. Alternatively create a bootable USB to perform a clean installation.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 using the Windows Media Creation Tool?
Response: Download and run the Windows Media Creation Tool select 'Create installation media for another PC' and follow the on-screen instructions to create a bootable USB drive.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 with a local account?
Response: During the setup choose the 'Offline account' option when prompted for a Microsoft account. This will allow you to create a local account for signing into Windows.

Query: How do I create a bootable Windows 10 USB on a Mac without using Boot Camp?
Response: Download the Windows 10 ISO file use the Terminal to format the USB drive and use the 'dd' command to create a bootable USB drive from the ISO file.

Query: How do I perform a network installation of Windows 10 on multiple computers?
Response: Set up a PXE server to enable network installation of Windows 10. Configure each target machine to boot from the network and follow the prompts to install Windows.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a computer without a hard drive?
Response: Use a bootable USB drive or network installation method such as PXE boot to install Windows on a computer that doesnâ€™t have an internal hard drive.

Query: How do I fix 'Windows 10 installation is stuck on the screen' error?
Response: Try restarting the system check for sufficient disk space and ensure the installation media is not corrupted. If needed boot into Safe Mode and troubleshoot further.

Query: How do I upgrade from Windows 8 to Windows 10 without losing files?
Response: Use the Windows Media Creation Tool to upgrade from Windows 8. Select the 'Keep my files' option during the upgrade process to ensure your data is preserved.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a system with a broken screen?
Response: You can use an external monitor or connect the system to a TV to complete the installation process. Alternatively use remote desktop or other tools to assist in setup.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a virtual machine without an activation key?
Response: You can install Windows 10 without an activation key but it will be in trial mode. Some personalization features will be limited until you enter a valid product key.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 with a custom partition scheme?
Response: During installation choose the 'Custom' installation option and manually configure the partitions based on your desired scheme.

Query: How do I fix the issue where Windows installation fails after restarting?
Response: Check the boot order in BIOS and ensure the installation media is still set as the primary boot device. If the issue persists check for hardware issues or corrupt installation media.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 on a computer with a damaged hard drive?
Response: If the hard drive is partially functional you may be able to install Windows but it's recommended to replace the damaged drive to ensure reliable performance.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 from a downloaded ISO file without burning it to a DVD?
Response: Use a tool like Rufus to create a bootable USB drive from the ISO file and boot from the USB drive to install Windows 10.

Query: How do I reinstall Windows 10 after a failed upgrade?
Response: Use the Windows Media Creation Tool to create a bootable USB and perform a fresh installation of Windows 10. Make sure to back up your files first.

Query: How do I install Windows 10 without creating a partition?
Response: During installation select the drive and let the installer automatically create and format the necessary partitions without manually adjusting them.

Query: How do I create a bootable Windows 10 USB on a Mac without using Boot Camp?
Response: Use the 'dd' command in Terminal or a tool like UNetbootin to create a bootable USB drive with the Windows 10 ISO on a Mac.

Query: How does the kernel interact with hardware?
Response: The Windows kernel interacts with hardware through device drivers which allow it to manage hardware components such as the CPU memory storage devices and input/output devices.

Query: What are the types of kernels?
Response: There are several types of kernels including monolithic kernels microkernels hybrid kernels and exokernels. Each type differs in how they handle system processes and hardware management.
A monolithic kernel is a type of kernel where the core functions including process management memory management and device drivers are all integrated into a single large block of code.

A microkernel is a type of kernel that aims to provide minimal functionality in the kernel space leaving most services such as device drivers file systems and network protocols to user-space processes.
Kernel space is a memory area where the core of the operating system (the Windows kernel) runs with high privileges. It has direct access to hardware and system resources.
User space is the memory area where user-level applications and processes run. It operates with lower privileges than kernel space limiting direct access to hardware.

Query: What is the role of a device driver in the kernel?
Response: A device driver is software that enables the Windows kernel to communicate with hardware devices. It abstracts the details of the hardware and provides a standardized interface for the kernel and applications to use.

Query: How does the kernel manage memory?
Response: The Windows kernel manages memory through a memory management unit (MMU) which handles the allocation deallocation and swapping of memory between processes to ensure efficient use of system resources.
A system call is a request made by a user-space program to the Windows kernel to perform privileged operations such as file access process control or device manipulation.

Query: How does the kernel manage processes?
Response: The Windows kernel manages processes by scheduling them for execution on the CPU allocating resources such as memory and I/O devices and ensuring that they do not interfere with each other.

Process scheduling is the method by which the Windows kernel determines which processes are executed by the CPU and for how long. It ensures that all processes receive a fair share of system resources and helps prevent starvation.
A context switch occurs when the Windows kernel saves the state of a running process and loads the state of another process. This enables multitasking by allowing multiple processes to share the CPU.

A kernel module is a piece of code that can be loaded or unloaded into the Windows kernel at runtime. It extends the functionality of the kernel such as adding support for new hardware or file systems.

Virtual memory is a memory management technique that gives the illusion of a larger amount of memory than is physically available. It uses both RAM and disk space to store data swapping between them as needed.

Paging is a memory management scheme that divides memory into fixed-size blocks known as pages. It allows the operating system to use physical memory efficiently by swapping pages in and out of secondary storage.

Query: What is segmentation in memory management?
Response: Segmentation is a memory management technique where memory is divided into segments based on logical divisions such as code data and stack. Each segment can vary in size.

Query: What is a system call interface?
Response: The system call interface is the mechanism that allows user-space programs to request services from the Windows kernel. It defines the interface between user space and kernel space.

A kernel panic is a critical error in the operating system that causes it to stop functioning. It typically occurs when the Windows kernel encounters an unexpected condition or bug that prevents it from continuing safely.

A race condition occurs when two or more processes access shared resources simultaneously and the outcome depends on the timing of their execution. This can lead to inconsistent or unexpected behavior.
Deadlock is a situation where two or more processes are unable to proceed because each is waiting for the other to release resources. It results in a standstill where no process can continue.

Query: What is the difference between a kernel and a shell?
Response: The kernel is the core part of the operating system that manages hardware and system resources while the shell is a command-line interface that allows users to interact with the operating system.

Query: What is interrupt handling in the kernel?
Response: Interrupt handling is the process by which the Windows kernel responds to interruptsâ€”signals from hardware or software that require immediate attention. The kernel suspends its current activities to handle the interrupt.
A process is an instance of a program in execution. It consists of the program code its data and its execution context which includes CPU registers memory and other resources.
A thread is the smallest unit of execution within a process. Multiple threads within the same process can share resources like memory while running independently.
Multitasking is the ability of an operating system to run multiple processes or threads concurrently giving the illusion of simultaneous execution on a single CPU.
A kernel thread is a thread that is managed and executed by the Windows kernel. Unlike user threads kernel threads have direct access to kernel resources.
A user thread is a thread that is managed by a user-level thread library with the kernel unaware of its existence. User threads rely on kernel threads for execution.

Query: What is a kernel thread vs a user thread?
Response: Kernel threads are managed by the Windows kernel have full access to kernel resources and can perform privileged operations. User threads are managed by a user-level thread library and operate in user space.
A file system is a method for organizing storing and retrieving files on storage devices. The kernel provides the file system interface for applications to interact with files.
A block device is a type of storage device that allows data to be read or written in fixed-size blocks such as hard drives SSDs and USB drives.
A character device is a type of device that handles data as a stream of characters such as a keyboard or a serial port.
I/O scheduling is the method by which the Windows kernel manages the input/output operations to ensure efficient use of system resources and minimize delays in device communication.

Query: What is a buffer in the kernel?
Response: A buffer is a temporary memory area used to store data being transferred between different components of the system such as between the CPU and I/O devices.
A filesystem mount is the process by which the operating system makes a storage device or file system available for access by the system and applications.

Query: What is the role of the kernel in process creation?
Response: The Windows kernel is responsible for creating and managing processes allocating resources setting up process context and scheduling the process for execution.

Query: What is the purpose of the init process?
Response: The init process is the first process created by the Windows kernel during boot. It is responsible for initializing system services and managing system startup tasks.

Query: What is a system call table?
Response: A system call table is a data structure used by the Windows kernel to map system call numbers to the corresponding kernel functions. It enables the kernel to handle system calls efficiently.
A kernel buffer is a temporary storage area used by the Windows kernel to store data during input/output operations typically used to improve performance by reducing the number of I/O operations.
Kernel space memory is the portion of the system's memory that is reserved for the kernel and its operations. It has higher privileges than user space memory.
User space memory is the area of memory where user-level applications and processes run. It is isolated from kernel space to prevent unauthorized access to system resources.

Query: What is the difference between kernel space and user space?
Response: Kernel space is reserved for the Windows kernel and system-level operations while user space is where user applications run. Kernel space has higher privileges and can directly access hardware whereas user space operates with restricted access.

Query: What is a process control block?
Response: A process control block (PCB) is a data structure used by the Windows kernel to store information about a process such as its state program counter memory allocation and CPU registers.
An interrupt vector is a table that the Windows kernel uses to map interrupt requests to specific interrupt handlers or routines enabling the system to respond to hardware and software interrupts.
A system resource refers to any part of the hardware or software that is required by processes to function such as CPU time memory disk space or network bandwidth.

Query: What is an interrupt service routine?
Response: An interrupt service routine (ISR) is a function executed by the Windows kernel in response to an interrupt handling the specific task that the interrupt was triggered for.

A blue screen appears when the system encounters a hardware problem or error displaying information like a STOP code a crash dump file and a stack trace.

Query: What is a crash dump file?

Query: What is a kernel mode error?

Query: What happens when an exception occurs in a process being debugged?
Response: When an exception occurs the system notifies the debugger by passing the exception to it (first-chance notification) and suspends all threads in the process.
First-chance notification is when the system notifies the debugger of an exception in a process allowing the debugger to handle the exception.

Query: What happens if the debugger does not handle the exception after first-chance notification?
Response: If the debugger does not handle the exception the system attempts to locate an appropriate exception handler.
Last-chance notification occurs if the system cannot locate an appropriate exception handler and it notifies the debugger again before terminating the process.

Query: What happens if the debugger does not handle the exception after last-chance notification?
Response: If the debugger does not handle the exception after last-chance notification the system terminates the process being debugged.

Query: What is the purpose of exception handling functions in debugging?
Response: Exception handling functions are used to handle exceptions that occur in a process being debugged notifying the debugger and allowing appropriate responses.

Query: What function creates a new thread for a process in debugging?

Query: What function is used to obtain a handle to a thread?

Query: What access permissions are required to examine or modify a thread's registers?
